Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 2nd overall pick, by Troy in 1966...
Had first career hit on 7/14/1966, off David Trinkle (CC)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/26/1966, off Reginald Ledbetter (SYR)...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Syracuse on 8/22/1970...
Signed as a free agent by Wisconsin on 2/6/1972 to a 4-year deal worth $8,000,000 per year...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Won World Championship with Wisconsin in 1972...
Injured on 4/17/1973 with a Strained Groin Muscle, out for 4-5 weeks...
Injured on 10/8/1973 with a Pulled Achilles Tendon, out for 6-7 weeks...
Traded from Wisconsin to Troy on 1/31/1975 (Going to TRO: 2B O. Erhart. Going to WIS: P J. Brace, P R. Barnett)...
Signed as a free agent by West Texas on 2/16/1976 to a 3-year deal worth $4,600,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1976, hitting .591 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Injured on 8/3/1977 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Had 5 hits with 7 RBI against Pontiac on 5/20/1978...
Signed as a free agent by Columbus on 2/1/1979 to a 4-year deal worth $5,222,222 per year...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Had 2000th career hit on 7/30/1982, off Stephen Flowers (PIT)...
Signed as a free agent by Gashouse on 2/15/1983 to a 2-year deal worth $5,800,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/21/1983, hitting .452 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Halifax on 7/11/1983...
